model

Interface PredictionModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FootballPredictionModel

    public interface PredictionModel
    Interface defining core methods required for any sport PredictionModel
    Author:
    Craig

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addData(java.util.List<BetfairProbabilityItem> newProbabilites)
      Add the given probability data to the existing collections for the runners in this market

      Mark the market that the PredictionModel observes as closed.

    • Method Detail

      • getMarketName

        java.lang.String getMarketName()
        Returns:
        The name of the market that the model object is for

      • initialize

        void initialize(java.util.List<BetfairProbabilityItem> newProbabilities)
        Initilise the prediction models internal collections with the given values
        Parameters:
        newProbabilities - The first set of probability values for the markets runners

      • getPredictions

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPredictions()
        Returns:
        The list of predictions that have just been made by this predictionmodel

      • addData

        void addData(java.util.List<BetfairProbabilityItem> newProbabilites)
        Add the given probability data to the existing collections for the runners in this market
        Parameters:
        newProbabilites - probability data that is to be added

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true if the market has closed. False otherwise

      • closeMarket

        void closeMarket()
        Mark the market that the PredictionModel observes as closed. One more possible prediction event will be produced by it, depending on if the market closing relates to an event (e.g. for football: penalty market shuts when a penalty occurs)

      • getMostRecentTime

        java.lang.String getMostRecentTime()
        Returns:
        The most recent calculated timestamp that data was received for (e.g. for football : 45 + 1:02)

      • getFavouredRunner

        java.lang.String getFavouredRunner()
        Parameters:
        market - The name of the market that the favoured runner is being requested for
        Returns:
        null if the PredictionModel doesn't represent the given market. It gives the runner name with the highest initial probability if the market name matches the internal market name.

      • getRecentValues

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRecentValues()
        Returns:
        The most recent data added. In the form of 'runner name, timestamp, value'
